00021 
00022 typedef void (*mrTimerHandler_t) (int);
00023 
00024 /* init the timer library
00025 parameter:
00026   iBaseTime - base time in micro seconds
00027  */
00028 int initMRTimers(int iBaseTime);
00029 
00030 /* release the timer library
00031  */
00032 int releaseMRTimers();
00033 
00034 /* set a debug message flag
00035  * result: current debug flags 
00036  */
00037 int setMRTimerDebugFlag(int iFlag);
00038 
00039 /* clear a debug message flag
00040  * result: current debug flags 
00041  */
00042 int clearMRTimerDebugFlag(int iFlag);
00043 
00044 /* starts a timer of the specified type
00045  * parameter:
00046  *   iType - ITIMER_REAL, ITIMER_VIRTUAL, ITIMER_PROF
00047  * result:
00048  *   id of the timer if succeeded, negative error code if failed
00049  */
00050 int startTimer(int iType);
00051 
00052 
00053 /* set timeout and handler for a timer
00054  * parameter:
00055  *   id - id of timer returned by startTimer
00056  *   iTimeOutSec, iTimeOutUsec - the time out in seconds and micro seconds
00057  *   handler - handler to be called at time out
00058  * result: 0 if succeeded, negative error code if failed
00059  */
00060 int setTimerHandler(int id, int iTimeOutSec, int iTimeOutUsec, mrTimerHandler_t handler);
00061 
00062 /* stop the timer with specified id
00063  * parameter:
00064  *   id - id of the timer, returned by startTimer
00065  * result: 0 if succeeded, negative error code if failed
00066  */
00067 int stopTimer(int id);
00068 
00069 /* get the timer value
00070  * parameter:
00071  *   id - id of timer returned by startTimer
00072  *   pSec, pUsec - pointer to int to receive the full time result
00073  * result: time in seconds, negative error code if failed
00074  */
00075 int getTimerValue(int id, int* pSec, int* pUsec);
00076 
00077 /* get the timer value in a formated string
00078  * parameter:
00079  *   id - id of timer returned by startTimer
00080  * result: pointer to string, empty string if failed
00081  */
00082 const char* getTimerValueString(int id);
00083
